content.body: For the "names" PR: I updated it with the changes that we discussed in the last "Scopes" meeting and now I'm waiting for reviews.
Is this about sourceMappingUrl not being allowed in multiline comments?
Just to be clear, multi line comments are `/* #sourceMappingUrl= */`? The spec never mentions these so they are implicitly disallowed anyway? I'm not opposed to calling it out explicitly though.
content.formatted_body: Just to be clear, multi line comments are /* #sourceMappingUrl= */? The spec never mentions these so they are implicitly disallowed anyway? I'm not opposed to calling it out explicitly though.

content.body: That was my guess. We don't mention either way right now, for some reason I thought Nic had some thoughts about what we can and can't say about the comment. I know we discussed last line of file which we decided *not* to specify, instead specifying the last occurence via https://github.com/tc39/source-map/blob/main/source-map.bs#L796
content.formatted_body: That was my guess. We don't mention either way right now, for some reason I thought Nic had some thoughts about what we can and can't say about the comment. I know we discussed last line of file which we decided not to specify, instead specifying the last occurence via https://github.com/tc39/source-map/blob/main/source-map.bs#L796

content.body: But removing them seems very risky, we would need first to make sure no tool actually generates them
I was thinking about replying to the post asking if they know which tool was generating them? I haven't seen the before

From that tweet:

> nested sourcemap multiline comments

If it's nested in a bundle, it's not a source map comment so the tool was _correctly_ removing it
content.formatted_body:
From that tweet:

nested sourcemap multiline comments

If it's nested in a bundle, it's not a source map comment so the tool was correctly removing it

i.e. in

let modules = {
  0: () => {
    console.log("hi from mod a");
    // #sourceMappingURL=./a.js.map
  },
  1: () => {
    console.log("hi from mod b");
    /* #sourceMappingURL=./b.js.map */
  }
}

there are no source map comments

content.body: You are saying that bundlers should remove sourceMappingUrl comments from individual files as it bundles them together?
They don't need to remove them, because "adding some code after the comment" already has the effect of making it not a source map comment
Bundlers removing them is equivalent to removing `/* hello! */`
content.formatted_body: Bundlers removing them is equivalent to removing /* hello! */

content.body: It's just useless, other than to save code size
Do you want me to reply to that tweet?
Sorry yeah if you don't mind. I'm not following but also distracted in this community event.
